basics.name: Danish Singh Sethi
basics.summary: Aspiring Software Engineer with a zeal for developing technology to better the world.

work.name: Platinum Systems
work.summary: Developing and optimizing an Android application using Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
highlights: Optimized the Android app's frontend with Kotlin, improving UI responsiveness and performance.
Led migration from XML to Jetpack Compose, reducing code complexity by 30% and modernizing the frontend.
Boosted database query efficiency by 25% with optimized SQL queries for a remote MariaDB server.

work.name: Insort GmbH
work.summary: Developing computer vision and machine learning solutions for quality control.
highlights: Pioneered a computer vision system for automated hazelnut quality control with 95% accuracy, easing defect detection.
Architected ML pipeline with CNNs, SVMs, and transfer learning in TensorFlow, boosting accuracy by 40%.
Leveraged VGG16 architecture for feature extraction and SVM classification, optimizing model performance.
Implemented SIFT-CNN with PyTorch, achieving optimal results and reducing manual inspection time by 75%.

work.name: University of Applied Sciences, Landshut
work.summary: Building web applications with React and AWS for sensor data visualization.
highlights: Built React/TypeScript app with AWS & Chart.js, visualizing sensor data and weather forecasts dynamically.
Used S3, DynamoDB, Lambda, Cognito, & Amplify for data handling, updates, security, and deployment.
Boosted frost prediction accuracy by 20% with automated updates via RESTful APIs (API Gateway).

work.name: AGCO Corp
work.summary: Developing web applications for farm machinery telemetry data.
highlights: Developed a React web app to provide farm machinery dealers access to telemetry data for performance analysis.
Designed and implemented a reporting system with AWS & Chart.js to generate machine performance reports.
Improved data retrieval speed by 20% with Lambda functions for efficient interaction with S3 and DynamoDB.
Enhanced API response times by 25% by integrating API Gateway for seamless app-backend communication.

work.name: AGCO Corp
work.summary: Analyzing after-sales data and performing sentiment analysis.
highlights: Extracted insights from after-sales data using Databricks & MS Excel.
Performed sentiment analysis & topic extraction on comments on AGCO-owned YouTube channels using NLTK.
Wrote a Python script with sktime to optimize forecasting models for machinery stock keeping units.
Achieved 96.9% reduction in time taken for cross-validation through effective optimization techniques.

research.name: Secure & Transparent Systems Laboratory
highlights: Built a web app to assist cybersecurity analysts trace suspicious activity through provenance graph visualization
Employed Splunk for data hosting, React and Splunk UI Toolkit for the frontend, and Flask for the backend.
Implemented graph visualization using React Flow and vis.js.

research.name: Institute of Communications Research
highlights: Enhanced a clone of the X social media platform using Next.js/TypeScript and storing user data on Firebase.
Implemented viewport-based exposure tracking and repost-chain visualization.
Engineered custom event tracking system to capture user interaction metrics and post visibility duration in real-time.

volunteer.organization: Civic Engagement Committee - UIUC Honors Student Council
volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Supported environmental sustainability by participating in six Illini Lights Out events, conserving around $700 worth of electricity by turning off lights in campus buildings.
Organized the “Annual Season of Giving” community Christmas event at the Helping Our Youth Change Everyday (HOYCE) Center, Champaign IL in December 2023.
Volunteered at the Urbana-Champaign Books to Prisoners sale in October 2023, contributing to the effort to supply incarcerated individuals with free books.
Proudly represented the Campus Honors Program by overseeing a bookmark-making station at the UIUC Fall 2023 Queer Block Party in September 2023.

education.institution: Technische Universität Wien (Vienna University of Technology)
Wirtschaftsuniversität Wien (Vienna University of Economics and Business)
courses: Austria and Europe: A Political, Economic, and Cultural History

awards.title: Chancellor's Scholar
awards.summary: Approximately 600 undergraduate students at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign participate in the Campus Honors Program (CHP). These students, designated Chancellor's Scholars, represent all colleges and a huge variety of disciplines on campus. They take several small, intensive, and collaborative courses in a wide range of fields. Chancellor's Scholars also participate in co-curricular experiences, including domestic or international travel courses as well as campus and community exploration. The CHP is for students who desire a broad and general as well as specialized education.

awards.title: Edmund J. James Scholar
awards.summary: Students who maintain a minimum GPA of 3.5 can self-nominate to be a James Scholar.

awards.title: Edward Fichtner and Paula Sutter Fichtner Award
awards.awarder: Department of Germanic Languages and Literatures (UIUC)
awards.summary: Competitive scholarship awarded to up to two students per year to participate in the Illinois in Vienna study abroad program.

awards.title: Pauline Steiner Schwalbe Undergraduate Student Award
awards.awarder: Department of Germanic Languages and Literatures (UIUC)
awards.summary: Awarded to an undergraduate student enrolled in the Department of Germanic Languages and Literatures and studying abroad in a program recognized by the department.

awards.title: Terry and Mary Claire Welch Award
awards.awarder: Department of Germanic Languages and Literatures (UIUC)
awards.summary: Awarded to recognize Academic Achievement in German of an undergraduate student.
